alert.note: Alert for Apache (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 01 at 10:54PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY FOR SNOWMELT NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 PM MST/MIDNIGHT MDT/ TUESDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by snowmelt continues. * WHERE...A portion of northeast Arizona, including the following county, Apache. * WHEN...Until 1100 PM MST Tuesday /midnight MDT Wednesday/. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in creeks and normally dry washes is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1053 PM MST /1153 PM MDT/, local law enforcement reported flooding in Chinle Wash. Minor flooding is already occurring. - Chinle Wash is the most likely place to experience minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Chinle, Canyon De Chelly National Monument and Navajo Reservation. - Visit www.weather.gov/safety/flood for more information on flood safety.
info.instruction: Keep children away from culverts, creeks and washes! Water levels can rise rapidly and sweep children away. Stay away or be swept away! The banks of creeks and washes are unstable and unsafe during any flooding event.
